remarks: Version of ~ sbcel1g when substituting a set.  (Note: one could have a corresponding version of ~ sbcel12 when substituting a set, but the point here is that the antecedent of ~ sbcel1g is not needed when substituting a set.)  (Contributed by BJ, 6-Oct-2018.)
statement:
bj-sbel1 $p |- ( [ y / x ] A e. B <-> [_ y / x ]_ A e. B ) $.
$d B x $.
